tweets.text: @scottdegg @SianieRoo @EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @BGFinvestments @StinkStopthe Same stench , different name . Yet another new sign needed outside the place now then as the other said red industries rm ltd on it . @StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off

Regurgitated meaningless words that do not convey any care/interest in the community at all. This is one of the many reasons the entire town is united in their resolve to have @RedIndustries2 Wally’s Quarry removed from the town @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off #stopthestink https://t.co/ej1ZR369Cm

Welcome to Newcastle 😡 and this is what will cause the demise of our local hospitality and shops. No-one wants to eat, drink or shop with that toxic, harmful gas around. @NewsNBC @StinkStopthe @PHE_uk @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids #StopTheStink #capitoff https://t.co/e3bl7O43rG

Clean air and healthy people are more important than anything else. Spending time with loved ones safely outdoors without gas invasion comes a close second. Enough is enough @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland @Cap_it_off #stopthestink https://t.co/Fit2hDBHn3

I can’t phone them, am too angry to be civil & know it’s not the call operators fault, I email them instead purely to keep my blood pressure down! @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @ClareDinnisEA @Cap_it_off #stopthestink https://t.co/4c3xD0PsG6

No one can justify this travesty. The @EnvAgency either have a standard that they fairly apply across the board or they have no standards or equitable approach.Which is it @JamesBevanEA ? @ClareDinnisEA @PHE_EoEngland Cap it.Close it.Clean it @Cap_it_off #stopthestink https://t.co/PYy2TSdyQ8
For those with eyes to see, it is as clear as day and as minging as minging can be !!! @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe #StopTheStink https://t.co/XpdTCP0I1h

Interesting rumours that @RedIndustries2 have changed the name of the landfill to Wally’s Quarry LTD. They do still manage the landfill though. Smart move Red - feels like you’re preparing for an imminent change @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off #stopthestink

Walleys Quarry Ltd formerly known as RED Industries RM Ltd’ night has come as has  @RedIndustries2 toxic stink. Winds change along with the name but it’s the same out of control stench, we can’t breathe @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @NewsNBC @StinkStopthe #stopthestink https://t.co/vUB96vRPwr

At @PrivateEyeNews Thank You for casting your green eye over this for us Shame on all those who allowed it to get to this state and damage people so. @PHE_uk @PHE_WestMids @AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @StinkStopthe #RedWalleysIndustriesQuarrey https://t.co/zZG4rB6s0o

@Signal1Official All I can say is that this town doesnt want their money. We just want clen, breathable air. We want our freedom back. Supporting sports and charities maybe written into the policies for companies like this but it is handcuffing those who have to suffer. Stop The Stink or 👣

📝 #WalleysQuarry operator Red Industries has provided us a statement following the #StopTheStink protest yesterday.

You can read it in full here ⤵️ https://t.co/zys6KTppo1
@RedIndustries2 Could you supply Newcastle and surrounding area’s with this breathing apparatus please it would really help #buryyourheadinthethesand #StopTheStink #WalleysQuarry
@HenleyMermaids @WindrushWasp @AnglianWater @EnvAgency Followed!

In reply to @BBCLondonNews' item on @ThamesWater illegally dumping sewage into the Thames @EnvAgency issued a statement saying, the EA "Has put pressure on the water industry to better protect the environment".

How's that working out then?

Starts: 1:10.

@Signal1Official Please cut all ties with @RedIndustries2. tweets.text: Today we published “Doing its job?”, a report on the @EnvAgency and its role protecting English rivers, lakes and streams. The report shows Agency failing to protect rivers, with its hands tied by central Gov. The time to reverse river damage is now https://t.co/y71Uhx7jzp

@RussellB1ggs @BBCCountryfile @SEGandrewK Big changes on ocean currents? Our lack of April showers now not drawing them in? Maybe they smell all the pig poo in our rivers and decide that Norfolk isn't that great?

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.
